result.execSummary:
The defendant Jonathan H Larson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Stayed.
Huber granted.
Credit for 9 days, if revoked.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain full time employment and/or school.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
Not to operate a MV unless properly licensed.

Case 15CT784 was dismissed and read into: 15CM321.

timeConds.notes:
Condition Time - STAYED and to be used at the Agent's discretion.
Agent to determine with or without nonworking hours.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Jail/HOC 11/25/15
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jonathan H Larson in court with attorney Christopher H. Wackman.  Andrea M. Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel is requesting a plea and sentencing date. Court grants.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jonathan H Larson in court with attorney Christopher H. Wackman.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State to provide discovery today.  Hearing scheduled for August 4, 2015 at 09:00 am.
dated 6/16/15 filed by Atty. Wackman; advising the Court that he got retained on this matter and will be present at the hearing set for 6/22/15

Defendant Jonathan H Larson in court.  Lucas Paul Bennewitz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has talked with Atty. Wackman and speak with him today at 11:00.  Defendant will retain him and was informed he court not attend today.  Hearing scheduled for June 22, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.

Defendant Jonathan H Larson in court, in custody.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for June 15, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.
Defendant Jonathan H Larson not in court.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
